cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,21st October 1919.Repeated to General Officer Commanding, Constantinople, under No. 76842.)(Received 23rd.)Malleson wires 19th October : " An agent who stayed in Oharjui; During above period he counted 14 trains with wounded from Askabad, nucleus going towards Tashkent. In same states that two troop trains, about 500 men each, passed east to west. Trains hurried over Oxus bridge which is being repaired. Its proper reparation, however, cannot be under-taken owing to lack of plant and material. Apparently central piers have sunk and are out of upright, being slightly inclined down stream direction. River is now low."
